event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Memory module errors exceeded acceptable levels
event_registry_properties.name: po-description
event_registry_properties.item: The number of errors associated with this memory module has exceeded acceptable levels.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The %DISTRO% Fault Manager has determined that one or more uncorrectable (multibit) memory errors indicating a fault which requires repair action is present.
event_registry_properties.name: po-response
event_registry_properties.item: Pages of memory associated with this memory module are being removed from service as errors are reported.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The system will attempt to remove the affected physical memory page from service after restart of one or more specific services, or the entire system.
event_registry_properties.name: po-impact
event_registry_properties.item: Total system memory capacity will be reduced as pages are retired.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item:
This error will cause either a system panic or restart of one or more user processes, with resulting interruption in service.

After restart, the performance of the system may be minimally impacted as a result of removing the physical memory page from operation.
event_registry_properties.name: po-action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected memory module. Use fmdump -v -u <EVENT_ID> to identify the module.
event_registry_properties.name: action
details
